thread.title: Small plane crashes near a football stadium in Shenandoah, Tex., authorities say - @abc13houston
thread.title_full: Small plane crashes near a football stadium in Shenandoah, Tex., authorities say - @abc13houston

author: Shelley Ng
title: Small plane crashes near a football stadium in Shenandoah, Tex., authorities say - @abc13houston
text: Small plane crashes in Shenandoah A small plane has crashed this afternoon in Shenandoah. Embed <iframe width="476" height="270" src="http://abc13.com/video/embed/?pid=826385" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe> Friday, July 03, 2015 02:25PM SHENANDOAH, TX (KTRK) -- A small plane has crashed this afternoon in Shenandoah.The Texas Department of Public Safety says around 12pm today, a 1963 Cessna 172 airplane crashed in the Woodforest Bank Stadium parking lot in the 19000 block of David Memorial Drive.The pilot is identified as Michael Wade Durr, of Houston. Authorites say Durr left Weser Airport between 10-10:30am and flew to Cleveland, refueled and headed back to Weser when his engine quit.Durr said he contacted Hooks Airport and said he had engine failure just before he crash landed in the parking lot.Only Durr was in the plane. We're told he was treated by emergency personnel and released. Keep checking back on this page to get real-time updates as this story unfolds. To get alerts for breaking news, download the ABC-13 news app for iPhone or Android . You can also get breaking news alerts sent to you by email . Related Topics:
